channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Incorrectly parked car., 25th July
item.description:
Car parked on the junction, not as it supposed to be, minimum 10m away. Happening every day for over 2 years now. Almost crashed my car multiple times. Car parked on Sapphire Road cross road with Cartmel Drive. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 141, Sapphire Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path/Way doesn't match map problem, 25th July

Definitive route obstructed by tied gates to W of wall. Signed & waymarked gate to E of wall
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path/Way doesn't match map problem, 25th July
item.description:
Cotswold Way alignment anomaly. Definitive alignment overgrown here - no access to SE into overgrown field. Waymarked & gated alignment crosses wall here. Photo 3 shows SE end of waymarked route which follows to S of old wall
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking on double yellow lines blocking entrance to access road, 25th July
item.description:
I live on Casino Place which is the only access to mine and my neighbours private parking for our properties. The Laundrette which is just along from the entrance to Casino place are parking several cars throuhgout the day on double yellow lines at the entrance right on the road. I would not normally mind at all however the parking on the road means that we cannot see at all to get out or go into the lane and it is making it extremely dangerous to use the road. Cars have to veer around the cars the Laundrette queue along to main road on the double yellow lines. Please can arrangements be made to prevent any parking on this main road along the double yellow lines as it simply means we cannot see and it is very likely to cause severe accidents/ .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Suffolk Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Reddings Road surface filling joints required, 25th July
item.description:
See photos of several gaps in the road. Starting ar house No 50 along the Reddings Road. Usally single file as cars are parked ,nose to tail, on the other side of the road. It is proving difficult to steer my bike!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Reddings Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle logo needs repainting after utility work, 25th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grovefield Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
